class.name: VoxelInstancer
class.brief_description: Spawns items on top of voxel surfaces.
class.description: Add-on to voxel nodes, allowing to spawn static elements on the surface. These elements are rendered with hardware instancing, can have collisions, and also be persistent. It must be child of a voxel node.

method.name: remove_instances_in_sphere
method.description: Removes all instances having their origin inside the given sphere. Coordinates are local to the instancer.

members.member: Hints the maximum time that should be spent updating collisions that are based on distance (see [member VoxelInstanceLibraryMultiMeshItem.collision_distance]). This time can still be exceeded if an operation takes longer, but then no further processing will occur until next frame.
Library from which instances to spawn will be taken from.

Hints the maximum time that should be spent updating mesh LODs (see "mesh LOD" properties on [VoxelInstanceLibraryMultiMeshItem]). This time can still be exceeded if an operation takes longer, but then no further processing will occur until next frame.
Where to consider the "up" direction is on the terrain when generating instances. See also [VoxelInstanceGenerator].

constants.constant: Up is towards the positive Y axis. This is the default assumption in Godot.
Up is opposite from the direction where the terrain's origin is. May be used if your terrain is a planet for example.
